channel.title: Run MoparScape Server through ssh (command line)?
channel.description:
I noticed the easiest way to start the server is through loading the game client as a GUI. Problem is, my linux server is accessed through command line. How can I run the server in command line?
EDIT: Got it working but now have the following errors:
jake@jake:~/2speced server$ bash run.sh Dds-specz v2 is now activated. npc.cfg: file not found. npcdrops.cfg: file not found. autospawn.cfg: file not found. item.cfg: file not found. globaldrops.cfg: file not found. doors.cfg: file not found. shops.cfg: file not found.

item.title: Run MoparScape Server through ssh (command line)?
item.dc:creator: @jake.bellotti jake.bellotti
item.description:
@jake.bellotti wrote:

I know nothing of linux, but you may have to change the directories.
eg.
For windows:
./data/cfg/npcdrops.cfg

For linux it may be different.
eg.
.data.cfg.npcdrops.cfg

Just remember i know nothing of linux.lol

Read full topic
item.source: Run MoparScape Server through ssh (command line)?

item.title: Run MoparScape Server through ssh (command line)?
item.dc:creator: @jakeandchase jakeandchase
item.description:
@jakeandchase wrote:

I noticed the easiest way to start the server is through loading the game client as a GUI. Problem is, my linux server is accessed through command line. How can I run the server in command line?

EDIT: Got it working but now have the following errors:

jake@jake:~/2speced server$ bash run.sh
Dds-specz v2 is now activated.
npc.cfg: file not found.
npcdrops.cfg: file not found.
autospawn.cfg: file not found.
item.cfg: file not found.
globaldrops.cfg: file not found.
doors.cfg: file not found.
shops.cfg: file not found.
